snippet: Underlying inflation in the United States went up more than expected in February. Other data showed the housing market continuing to strengthen.
abstract: Labor Dept reports consumer price index, excluding food and energy components, rose 0.3 percent in February, increase similar to January's; blame larger-than-expected increase on rising rents and medical costs.
lead_paragraph: Underlying inflation in the United States went up more than expected in February. Other data showed the housing market continuing to strengthen.

headline.main: Rents and Medical Costs Drive Inflation’s Rise
headline.print_headline: Rents and Medical Costs Drive Inflation Up
